name: WebVR
tagline: Bringing Virtual Reality to the Web
body:
### What is WebVR
WebVR is an experiemental Javascript API that provides access to Virtual Reality devices, such as the Oculus Rift or Google Cardboard, in your browser.

### How can I try it?
The WebVR API is currently only available in special browser builds provided by the developers, though we hope to make it part of the standard browser distributions eventually. You can get the latest experiemental builds here:

 * [Chrome](https://drive.google.com/folderview?id=0BzudLt22BqGRbW9WTHMtOWMzNjQ&usp=sharing#list)
 * [Firefox](http://vrhelloworld.com/builds/)

### How can I contribute?
The best place to contribute is the [WebVR mailing list](https://mail.mozilla.org/listinfo/web-vr-discuss). Developers of both the Chrome and Firefox builds are on that list, as well as other community members that are enthusiastic about VR on the Web.

### Misc Links
 * [Vlad's blog](http://blog.bitops.com/)
 * [Brandon's blog](http://blog.tojicode.com/)

_This page is a work in progress, more content coming soon._
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
